page.title: 03LODGES OF ARUNDEL PARK
page.content: A flint wall 6'6" high at present being repaired, encloses the park, interspersed with several entrance gates and lodges. One or two lodges have been demolished through lack of use and amenities. Those that remain have been modernised. They are built of flint in the style of miniature castles with turrets and castellated walls. The gates are painted in deep red known as Arundel red. Several lodges are inhabited by workers on the Norfolk Estate. High up in the park stands the Hiorne Tower, a shooting lodge built by an architect to show his skill when he hoped to be employed to restore Arundel Castle in the late 19th century.
